intro: Tournefortia acutiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually lanceolate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and are characteristic of the Malvaceae family. Tournefortia acutiflora is adapted to well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
